links.title: Making GitHub’s new homepage fast and performant
links.description: The GitHub engineering team shares interesting details about the performance optimizations for the Github homepage.

links.title: Making password managers play ball with your login form
links.description: A great summary on how to properly support password manages in login forms by Hidde de Vries.

links.title: Ultimate Laravel Performance Checklist
links.description: You can increase the performance of Laravel applications with many small changes. Paras Malhotra shared a checklist to optimize the performance of your application.

links.title: JS Minification Benchmarks
links.description: There are several tools available to properly minify your JS scripts. This benchmark checks the performance of the most popular tools.

links.title: PhpClean - small steps to the perfect code
links.description: You can make your PHP code much more readable and consistent with PhpClean, a coding strategy and ruleset, which is available as a plugin for PhpStorm.

links.title: ZSH Tricks to blow your mind
links.description: The folks of Twilio compiled a list of the best tricks and tipps for the ZSH shell.

links.title: The Future of Web Software is HTML-over-WebSockets
links.description: The future of web-based software architectures is already taking form, and this time it’s server-rendered (again).

links.title: Front-of-the-front-end and back-of-the-front-end
links.description: Brad Frost shares the idea of two different layers in frontend web development: the front and back end.
